source:
#### Read the question carefully. Download the dataset from the assignement section and then perform the following operation.

Link: https://github.com/Mahmudul-Hasan-Moon/python_for_research_assignment

1. Import the dirtydata data set. Perform quality assesment on the data set.

2. Fill the missing value of the data set by mean(), median() and mode()

3. Import data "kerala" data set and perform quality assesment on it.

4. Perform data cleaning operation on the data set.
## **1. Import the dirtydata data set. Perform quality assesment on the data set.**
Importing "dirtydata.xlsx"

from pydrive.auth import GoogleAuth
from pydrive.drive import GoogleDrive
from google.colab import auth
from oauth2client.client import GoogleCredentials

auth.authenticate_user()
gauth = GoogleAuth()
gauth.credentials = GoogleCredentials.get_application_default()
drive = GoogleDrive(gauth)

downloaded = drive.CreateFile({'id':'1RXs5e4YLMmsPCauSI2FegCPesUhS3VAA'}) # replace the id with id of file you want to access
downloaded.GetContentFile('dirtydata.xlsx')
Reading raw dataset

import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_excel("dirtydata.xlsx")
print(df)
Performing quality assesment tasks

import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_excel("dirtydata.xlsx")
x = df["Calories"].mode()[0]
df["Calories"].fillna(x, inplace = True)
df["Date"].fillna("2020/12/22",inplace = True)
df["Date"]=pd.to_datetime(df["Date"]).dt.date
df.drop_duplicates(inplace = True)
df.loc[26,"Date"]="2020-12-26"
df.loc[7,"Duration"]=45
print(df)
## **2.Fill the missing value of the data set by mean(), median() and mode()**
Filling up with mean values in calories column.

import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_excel("dirtydata.xlsx")
x = df["Calories"].mean()
df["Calories"].fillna(x, inplace = True)
df["Date"].fillna("2020/12/22",inplace = True)
df["Date"]=pd.to_datetime(df["Date"]).dt.date
df.drop_duplicates(inplace = True)
df.loc[7, "Duration"] = 45
print(df)
Filling up with median values in Calories column.

import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_excel("dirtydata.xlsx")
x = df["Calories"].median()
df["Calories"].fillna(x, inplace = True)
df["Date"].fillna("2020/12/22",inplace = True)
df["Date"]=pd.to_datetime(df["Date"]).dt.date
df.drop_duplicates(inplace = True)
df.loc[7, "Duration"] = 45
print(df)
Filling up with mode values in Calories column.

import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_excel("dirtydata.xlsx")
x = df["Calories"].mode()[0]
df.loc[7, "Duration"] = 45
df["Calories"].fillna(x, inplace = True)
df["Date"].fillna("2020/12/22",inplace = True)
df["Date"]=pd.to_datetime(df["Date"]).dt.date
df.drop_duplicates(inplace = True)
print(df)
## **3. Import data "kerala" data set and perform quality assesment on it.**
Importing "kerala.csv"

from pydrive.auth import GoogleAuth
from pydrive.drive import GoogleDrive
from google.colab import auth
from oauth2client.client import GoogleCredentials

auth.authenticate_user()
gauth = GoogleAuth()
gauth.credentials = GoogleCredentials.get_application_default()
drive = GoogleDrive(gauth)

downloaded = drive.CreateFile({'id':'1lDDqwPmzAPo8DG1wujBX4Mf8Vzywv4Nz'}) # replace the id with id of file you want to access
downloaded.GetContentFile('kerala.csv')
Reading raw dataset

import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_csv("kerala.csv")
print(df.to_string())
Performing quality assesment tasks

import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_csv("kerala.csv")
print("Dataframe size =",df.shape)
print('\n')
df.info()

source:
import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_csv("kerala.csv")
columns = df[["JAN", "FEB", "MAR", "APR", "MAY", "JUN", "JUL", "AUG", "SEP", "OCT", "NOV", "DEC", "ANNUAL", "Jan-Feb", "Mar-May", "Jun-Sep", "Oct-Dec"]]
x = columns.describe()
print(x.to_string())

print("Mean",'
',x.iloc[1],'
')
print('
',"Median",'
',x.iloc[5],'
')
print('
',"Standard deviation",'
',x.iloc[2],'
')
## **4.Perform data cleaning operation on the data set.**

import pandas as pd
df = pd.read_csv("kerala.csv")
print("Dataframe info =",df.info())
print('\n')
x = df.isna()
print(x.to_string())
print('\n')
print("Dataset is okay, No null values hence, no need for data cleaning!")
